headline: Trump washes hands of Perdue in Georgia as his campaign limps into final stretch
sentences: Trump isnt planning to make any more personal appearances in Georgia in Perdues behalf, having sunk enough of his own political capital in a race that looks like a lost cause, said a fourth source, a person close to the former president, speaking on condition of anonymity to talk more freely about Perdues prospects.

David either has a bunch of geniuses working for him  because hes basically spent no money  or hes run the most flawed campaign in America, this person said while noting that Perdue still has an outside shot at forcing a runoff.
Perdues campaigning  or its alleged lack thereof  has also come under question in Georgia, where The Atlanta Journal Constitution this week asked  in a report about his hard-to-find events.
Its a bitter dynamic for Trump, who has made his nationwide endorsements a sign of his influence in the party and part of his implicit case to be the GOPs presidential nominee in 2024.
You must be kidding, Sweat said by email, pointing out that NBC News reporters have covered and will continue to cover his events, which she noted are posted publicly on our website.
Even the man who recruited Perdue to run against Kemp  former President Donald Trump  seems to have given his campaign up for dead, said three Republicans who have spoken to Trump.
Now voters there, many of whom have grown weary of Trumps involvement in the state GOP, could reject Perdue, as well as other statewide candidates he has endorsed.
Kemps most recent internal campaign survey suggests similar results, said two sources who have seen the polling but werent authorized to discuss it publicly.
Trump has crusaded against Kemp after he refused to help him overturn the 2020 election results in Georgia, which helped cost him re-election.
A notable exception: former football star Herschel Walker, whos set for a big Senate primary win Tuesday and who was recruited by Trump.
Meanwhile, Kemp leads Perdue by 60 percent to 28 percent in a Georgia Republican conducted for Fox News that was released Wednesday.
